conclusion: Determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles from points A, B, C, and D.
Point A is on the left side.
Point B is slightly to the right of A.
Point C is further to the right.
Point D is on the far right.
Liquid from point A flows downward and encounters the first baffle (blue line) directing it to the right.
After passing the blue baffle, liquid from point A continues downward and encounters the second baffle (brown line) directing it further to the right.
Liquid from point A reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Liquid from point B flows downward and encounters the first baffle (blue line) directing it to the right.
After passing the blue baffle, liquid from point B continues downward and encounters the second baffle (brown line) directing it further to the right.
Liquid from point B reaches the bottom and flows into container F.
Liquid from point C flows downward and encounters the first baffle (blue line) directing it to the right.
After passing the blue baffle, liquid from point C continues downward and encounters the second baffle (brown line) directing it further to the right.
Liquid from point C reaches the bottom and flows into container G.
Liquid from point D flows downward and encounters the first baffle (blue line) directing it to the left.
After passing the blue baffle, liquid from point D continues downward and encounters the second baffle (brown line) directing it further to the left.
Liquid from point D reaches the bottom and flows into container G.
Liquid from point A will flow into container E.
Liquid from point B will flow into container F.
Liquid from points C and D will flow into container G.
